#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref

#Text=In order to improve the bond between the outer surface of the casing and the surrounding cement sheath, a commonly used procedure is to form a scabrous surface on the exterior of the casing string prior to the cement operation.
#Text=Thus, U.S.
#Text=Pat.

#Text=No. 3,255,819 to Scott et al discloses that a scabrous surface can be formed on the exterior casing surface by reducing the exterior surface of the casing or by adding particulate material to this surface.

#Text=Thus, the conduit may be subjected to knurling, abrading, etching or quilting procedures; or a particulate solid such as sand, rock, gravel, shell, frit, metal, metal shavings and the like can be applied to the exterior casing surface by means of a suitable adhesive material.
#Text=Particularly disclosed in Scott et al is the use of sand in an adhesive matrix formed of an epoxy resin.

#Text=In accordance with the present invention, there is provided a new and improved well-completion process and structure providing for an enhanced hydraulic bond between a well casing and a surrounding cement sheath.
#Text=The structure of the present invention comprises a string of casing disposed within a well extending to a subterranean location within the earth's crust.
#Text=A wrapping of a metal wire is disposed about the outer surface of the casing in a conformation providing a plurality of helical turns which crisscross one another.
#Text=The well is provided with a cement sheath in the annulus about the casing.
#Text=The cement sheath encompasses the metal wire to provide a bond between the cement and the casing surface.
#Text=In a preferred embodiment of the invention, the metal wire has a plurality of protrusions extending into the cement sheath.
#Text=In a further aspect of the invention, there is provided a well-completion process in which a cement-coated conduit is installed within a well.
#Text=In carrying out this process, a metal wire is secured to the conduit at a first location thereon.
#Text=The wire is pulled under tension and wrapped about the conduit in a manner providing a first series of successive helical turns about the conduit.

#Text=The direction of wrapping of the metal wire is then reversed at a second location on the conduit spaced longitudinally from the first location and the wire is then wrapped about the conduit to provide a second series of successive helical turns which overlap the turns in the first series.
#Text=The conduit is then installed in the well at the desired location and a slurry of hydraulic cement is flowed into the annulus about the conduit.
#Text=The slurry is allowed to set, thus forming a cement sheath which encompasses the metal wire and is bonded to the conduit.
#Text=FIG. 1 is a schematic illustration, partially in section, showing a well completed in accordance with the present invention;
#Text=FIG. 2 is a perspective view of a conduit being wrapped with metal wire in accordance with the present invention;
